weather_report:
The night sky over Evanston is cloaked in a thick veil of clouds, with temperatures resting gently around 67 degrees. A noticeable southwest wind, brisk and resolute, sweeps in at 20 to 25 mph, occasionally gusting up to 35 mph, leaving a hint of anticipation for the day ahead. As dawn approaches, the clouds will begin to part, allowing glimpses of sunshine to filter through, but the temperature will gradually fall to a comfortable 75 degrees by afternoon. Today promises to be partly sunny, although those same winds will remain, with gusts reaching as high as 40 mph, bringing a slight chill that may bite at the edges of any outdoor plans.

While the waves of Lake Michigan are not particularly fierce at this hour, the stirring winds may kick them up as the day unfolds, creating a dynamic backdrop for a stroll along the shore. Given the weather conditions, layers are advisable—perhaps a light jacket or a comfortable sweater to guard against the briskness. For those seeking solace in this urban setting, a walk along the beach or a visit to one of Evanston's charming coffee spots could provide a serene respite, allowing one to enjoy the quiet beauty that such a transitional time of year can bring. The weather now invites contemplation less than adventure, making it an ideal time to catch up on a book or indulge in moments of solitude as the world awakens.
